UEDGEToolBox.Doc module¶

class UEDGEToolBox.Doc.UBoxDoc(Verbose: bool = False)[source]¶

Bases: object

UBoxDoc is a wrapper for the documentation of the various UEDGE variables contained in UEDGE packages (e.g bbb,com,…).

Note

Aliases of the various public methods are available in the global namespace and can be access from the shell (e.g Search(‘ni’)).

Search(Str: str, Exact: bool = False, OnlyVar: bool = False, Silent: bool = False)[source]¶

Return the list of UEDGE variables for which the input string is contained in the variable name or/and documentation. Example: Search(‘ni’)

Parameters

  • Str (str) – string contained in names of UEDGE variables.

  • Exact (bool, optional) – look for exact match between input string and variable name. Defaults to False.

  • OnlyVar (bool, optional) – True: Print only UEDGE variable names | False: Print only UEDGE variable names and documentation. Defaults to False.

  • Silent (bool, optional) – Print list of results when Silent=False. Defaults to False.

Returns

return list of dictionaries describing UEDGE variables if Silent is True.

Return type

Out (list)

SearchDoc(Str: str)[source]¶

Print a list of UEDGE variables containing the string Search Str in their documentation.

Parameters

Str (str) – String contained in documentation of UEDGE variables.

Returns

None.

ShowGroup(PkgName: str = None)[source]¶

Print list of groups in package PkgName. If PkgName is None, print groups for all UEDGE package.

Examples

>>> Doc.ShowGroup('bbb')
>>> ShowGroup('bbb')
Parameters

PkgName (str, optional) – Name of package. Defaults to None.

ShowPackage()[source]¶

Print the list of UEDGE packages currently loaded in the global namespace.

>>> Doc.ShowPackage()
>>> ShowPackage()
ShowVar(ObjectName: str = None, Start: str = '', Contain: str = '', OnlyVar: bool = True, Sorted: bool = True)[source]¶

Print a list of UEDGE variables contained in packages or groups given by ObjectName. If ObjectName is None, all UEDGE variables are displayed. :param ObjectName: list or name of UEDGE groups or packages. Defaults to None. :type ObjectName: str or list, optional :param Start: Print only variables with name startingw with “Start”. Defaults to ‘’. :type Start: str, optional :param Contain: Print only variables with names containing “Contain”. Defaults to ‘’. :type Contain: str, optional :param OnlyVar: True: do not print documentation. Defaults to True. :type OnlyVar: bool, optional :param Sorted: Sort printed variables by name. Defaults to True. :type Sorted: bool, optional

Returns

None.

Get the foobar.

This really should have a full function definition, but I am too lazy.

>>> print get_foobar(10, 20)
30
>>> print get_foobar('a', 'b')
ab

Isn’t that what you want?

UEDGEToolBox.IO module¶

UEDGEToolBox.Launcher module¶

Launcher for UEDGEToolBox.

An instance “UBox” of UBoxLauncher is created and initialized when Launcher is imported. The following code snipet is executed when Launcher is imported:

>>> UBox=UBoxLaunch()
>>> from uedge import *
>>> (Doc)=UBox.Start()
>>> CurrentProject=UBox.CurrentProjectGetter
>>> CreateGlobalAliases(Doc,globals())
>>> CreateGlobalAliases(UBox,globals())
>>> UBox.Print('UEDGEToolBox sucessfully launched. Type QuickStart() for basic commands.')
class UEDGEToolBox.Launcher.UBoxBase(**kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: object

Launch instances of UEDGEToolBox modules.

Example

>>> UBox=UBoxLauncher()
>>> UBox.Start()
Launch(**kwargs)¶
Start(**kwargs)¶

UEDGEToolBox.Utils.QueryYesNo(question, default='yes')[source]¶

Ask a yes/no question via input() and return their answer.

“question” is a string that is presented to the user. “default” is the presumed answer if the user just hits <Enter>.

It must be “yes” (the default), “no” or None (meaning an answer is required of the user).

The “answer” return value is True for “yes” or False for “no”.

UEDGEToolBox.Utils.UBoxPrefix(cls)[source]¶

Module contents¶

UEDGEToolBox.

The module UEDGEToolBox is a collection of Python tools to manage and run UEDGE simulations and analyze the results.

A quickstart guide is available through QuickStart().

Module:

UEDGESettings contains the class UEDGESettings and UEDGEProjects

© Copyright 2020, Jerome Guterl

Built with Sphinx using a theme provided by Read the Docs.
